question.text: For an object placed at a distance <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from a lens, a sharp focused image is observed on a screen placed at a distance <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> from the lens. A glass plate of refractive index <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>5</mn></math> and thickness <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> is introduced between lens and screen such that the glass plate plane faces parallel to the screen. By what distance should the object be shifted so that a sharp focused image is observed again on the screen?

solution.text:
Given:
object using the lens formula:
\(\begin{aligned}& \frac{1}{f}=\frac{1}{v \prime}-\frac{1}{w^{\prime}} \\\Rightarrow & \frac{21}{240} \mathrm{~cm}=\frac{3}{35} \mathrm{~cm}-\frac{1}{u^{\prime}} \\\Rightarrow \frac{1}{u^{\prime}} & =\frac{3}{35} \mathrm{~cm}-\frac{21}{240} \mathrm{~cm} \\\Rightarrow & \frac{1}{u^{\prime}}=\frac{1}{5}\left[\frac{3}{7} \mathrm{~cm}-\frac{21}{48} \mathrm{~cm}\right] \\\Rightarrow \frac{1}{u^{\prime}} & =\frac{1}{5}\left[\frac{144-147}{336}\right] \\\Rightarrow u^{\prime} & =-560 \mathrm{~cm}=-5.6 \mathrm{~m}\end{aligned}\)
Hence, the object should be at \(5.6 \mathrm{~m}\) in front of the lens.
Hence, the oblect should be moved by 5.6-24= \(3.2 \mathrm{~cm}\).
